examples: Mind your own business!
You mind the cattle, Herb.
Mind if I take a rain check on that drink?
Travel broadens the mind.
My mind went totally blank.
words.defineEn: the ability in a person that makes them think, feel, or imagine
words.defineVi: khả năng ở một người khiến họ suy nghĩ, cảm nhận hoặc tưởng tượng

examples: She made a mental note to ask Alan about it.
Your brain needs mental stimulation to stay sharp, so if you don't challenge yourself intellectually, your cognitive abilities will decline - use it or lose it.
After attending the seminar on mental health, I became awake to the stigma surrounding mental illness and decided to become an advocate for greater awareness and understanding.
He was declared insane and ordered to be detained in a mental hospital at Her Majesty's pleasure.
Mental illness changes all the time.
words.defineEn: of or relating to someone's mind
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến tâm trí của một ai đó

examples: We thought the world of our teacher, Mr. Johnson.
He thought like a general.
Many people thought that the Internet would toll the death knell for newspapers.
Politicians think they can easily lead people by the nose.
She really thinks on her feet well.
words.defineEn: to use one's mind to understand something, solve a problem, make a decision, etc. or to use it to consider someone or something
words.defineVi: sử dụng tâm trí của một người để hiểu điều gì đó, giải quyết vấn đề, đưa ra quyết định, v.v. hoặc sử dụng nó để xem xét ai đó hoặc điều gì đó

examples: She turned her singing talent into extra money.
She turned her singing talent into extra money.
Talent, hard work, and professionalism are what truly sustain a career.
Her talent for organization should serve her well.
a sharp talent agent who has a finger in the pie in show business.
words.defineEn: an ability that a person naturally has in doing something well
words.defineVi: một khả năng mà một người tự nhiên có trong việc làm một cái gì đó tốt

examples: They practice their soccer skills every day after school.
We learn new skills from our parents, who teach us with patience.
A mixture of skill and good luck decided the outcome of the game.
I took my hat off to his cooking skill.
To learn a language/skill/trade.
words.defineEn: an ability to do something well, especially after training
words.defineVi: một khả năng để làm một cái gì đó tốt, đặc biệt là sau khi đào tạo

examples: Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
The locals generously shared their knowledge of manioc processing techniques.
I have no knowledge of the political dos and don'ts.
My knowledge of French is pretty basic.
Her knowledge of ancient history is of the first water, making her a respected authority in the field.
words.defineEn: understanding of or information about a subject after studying and experiencing it
words.defineVi: sự hiểu biết hoặc thông tin về một chủ đề sau khi nghiên cứu và trải nghiệm nó

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
Surely she would guess the truth.
He had already guessed the answer.
Far from eye, far from heart, I guess.
words.defineEn: an attempt to give an answer without having enough facts
words.defineVi: một nỗ lực để đưa ra một câu trả lời mà không có đủ sự thật

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
Surely she would guess the truth.
He had already guessed the answer.
Far from eye, far from heart, I guess.
words.defineEn: to consider something as true without being sure
words.defineVi: để coi một cái gì đó là đúng mà không chắc chắn

examples: The superintendent believed Lancaster's story.
I believed his lies for years.
Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
Many sports pundits believe the vultures are circling for the team's beleaguered head coach.
His opponents believe he is definitely on the run.
words.defineEn: to accept something to be true even without proof
words.defineVi: để chấp nhận một cái gì đó là sự thật ngay cả khi không có bằng chứng

examples: He has very firmly held religious beliefs.
She had a sure belief that hard work would lead to success.
The charity organization's mission statement emphasized the belief that poverty is no sin and that everyone deserves dignity and respect.
After careful consideration, he abandoned his previous beliefs and embraced a new ideology.
Plenty of Christians have tried their hand at putting their beliefs into prose or poetry, usually with calamitous aesthetic results.
words.defineEn: something that we think is true or real
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó mà chúng tôi nghĩ là đúng hoặc thực

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
Memories of that day still bring a lump to his throat.
The memory of all that blood made his flesh creep.
These events occurred within living memory.
As I bit into the mombin, its fibrous texture and tropical taste brought back childhood memories.
words.defineEn: the ability of mind to keep and remember past events, people, experiences, etc.
words.defineVi: khả năng lưu giữ và ghi nhớ các sự kiện, con người, kinh nghiệm trong quá khứ, v.v.

examples: Always remember that.
I'll always remember this holiday.
He couldn't remember the name of the movie for the life of him.
Remember Jackson.
I don't remember my first day at school.
words.defineEn: to bring a type of information from the past to our mind again
words.defineVi: để đưa một loại thông tin từ quá khứ vào tâm trí của chúng tôi một lần nữa

examples: We can't forget the limburger cheese!
My son never forgets to pack a few cherry tomatoes in his lunchbox.
I forgot my umbrella, and now I'm getting wet in the rain.
Don't forget to bring your books with you.
Don't forget to sprinkle some shredded cheese on the pizza as a tasty topping.
words.defineEn: to not be able to remember something or someone from the past
words.defineVi: để không thể nhớ một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó từ quá khứ

examples: ideas that are light-years ahead of their time
The idea hit me like a tornado.
Who's been putting ideas in your head?
Their ideas seem to be far more down to earth and sensible.
He’d run out of ideas.
words.defineEn: a suggestion or thought about something that we should do
words.defineVi: một gợi ý hoặc suy nghĩ về một cái gì đó mà chúng ta nên làm

examples: My sister's famous sweet cherry jam is a family favorite.
My son's favorite animal is the lion.
The little boy's favorite toy was a blue car.
What is your favorite color?
Our mascarpone cheesecake is a customer favorite
words.defineEn: liked or preferred the most among the rest that are from the same category
words.defineVi: thích hoặc được ưa thích nhất trong số những thứ còn lại cùng loại

examples: On the face of it, his suggestion makes sense.
Thanks for the pearl of wisdom, buddy, but your suggestion is ridiculous.
Could I make a suggestion?
She made the suggestions entirely off her own bat.
A CEO may receive helpful suggestions from the least experienced employee, as even a mouse may help a lion.
words.defineEn: the act of putting an idea or plan forward for someone to think about or consider
words.defineVi: hành động đưa ra một ý tưởng hoặc kế hoạch để ai đó suy nghĩ hoặc xem xét

examples: When the company had already lost a major client, the sales team suggested a new strategy.
An engineer suggested driving a tunnel through the Judean hills.
Recent economic performance suggests that a major crisis is at hand.
I suggest you wear another for today.
That last game suggests that we have been getting ahead of ourselves in praising the team's progress.
words.defineEn: to mention or put forward an idea, proposition, plan, etc. for further consideration or possible action
words.defineVi: để đề cập hoặc đưa ra một ý tưởng, đề xuất, kế hoạch, vv để xem xét thêm hoặc hành động có thể

examples: The ref gave the goal.
His first goal came in the 81st minute.
Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
She moved the ball toward the opponent's goal.
The goal is to involve workers in the decision-making process.
words.defineEn: our purpose or desired result
words.defineVi: mục đích của chúng tôi hoặc kết quả mong muốn

examples: I planned a surprise party for my little sister's birthday.
She planned a romantic candlelit meal for their anniversary.
They are planning a movie night at the movie theater with their family.
The plan ran into a brick wall.
The closing of the airport knocked our holiday plans on the head.
words.defineEn: a chain of actions that will help us reach our goals
words.defineVi: một chuỗi các hành động sẽ giúp chúng tôi đạt được mục tiêu của mình

examples: He's hoping for an offer of compensation.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
I hope you have it on your conscience for the rest of your days!
I hope this letter reaches you.
I hope you've learned a lesson from this, Eddie.
words.defineEn: to want something to happen or be true
words.defineVi: để muốn một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là sự thật

examples: He's hoping for an offer of compensation.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
I hope you have it on your conscience for the rest of your days!
I hope this letter reaches you.
I hope you've learned a lesson from this, Eddie.
words.defineEn: a feeling of expectation and desire for a particular thing to happen or to be true
words.defineVi: một cảm giác mong đợi và mong muốn một điều cụ thể xảy ra hoặc là sự thật

examples: She imagined a sunny day at the beach, enjoying a scoop of lemon curd ice cream.
Imagine two criminals, partners in crime, who are arrested and placed in separate cells with no means of communication.
She imagined kids making funny faces after trying scorzonera for the first time.
She imagined a magical land where the trees were made of cotton candy and the rivers flowed with white sugar.
He imagines himself as a chef, creating a masterpiece dish with Calabrese as the star ingredient.
words.defineEn: to make or have an image of something in our mind
words.defineVi: để thực hiện hoặc có một hình ảnh của một cái gì đó trong tâm trí của chúng tôi

examples: Sleep well and sweet dreams.
The wedding celebrations went like a dream.
Many actors dream of winning prestigious awards for their performances.
A few weeks later, I landed my dream job.
Our dream destination for this year's vacation is a secluded tropical island.
words.defineEn: to experience something in our mind while we are asleep
words.defineVi: để trải nghiệm một cái gì đó trong tâm trí của chúng tôi trong khi chúng tôi đang ngủ

examples: My friends enjoyed tangy barbecue gammon skewers at the summer barbecue.
The children enjoyed a refreshing slice of watermelon on a hot summer day.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
My vegetarian friend enjoyed a nourishing adzuki bean grain bowl for lunch.
The hiker enjoyed the scenic beauty of the river's gentle bends.
words.defineEn: to take pleasure or find happiness in something or someone
words.defineVi: để có niềm vui hoặc tìm thấy hạnh phúc trong một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Police are worried that many crimes go unreported.
I'm not worried about my finances.
She was worried she was stuck in a dead-end job.
I'm worried that I didn't give a good account of myself in that job interview today.
I’m not worried about stepping on anybody’s toes.
words.defineEn: feeling unhappy and afraid because of something that has happened or might happen
words.defineVi: cảm thấy không vui và sợ hãi vì điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc có thể xảy ra

examples: I was too nervous to eat.
I felt a bit nervous when the elevator suddenly stopped between floors.
I was nervous before my dental appointment, but the dentist made me feel comfortable.
He grew nervous about the deal and asked his bank manager to stop the cheque.
I was pretty nervous to start with, but after a while I was fine.
words.defineEn: tending to easily get worried or frightened about things
words.defineVi: có xu hướng dễ dàng lo lắng hoặc sợ hãi về mọi thứ

examples: It's the calm after a storm.
His judgment is calmer, and he puts the saddle on the right horse.
The night brings a sense of calm and tranquility.
What the country was experiencing was not peace, but just the calm before another storm.
She drank a glass of warm water to calm her upset stomach.
words.defineEn: not showing worry, anger, or other strong emotions
words.defineVi: không thể hiện sự lo lắng, tức giận hoặc những cảm xúc mạnh mẽ khác

examples: My friend is afraid he might go down with the flu.
I’m afraid I’ll have to pass on that offer of coffee.
I'm afraid I have to disagree with your interpretation of the data.
I was afraid he was going to hit me.
I'm afraid I'm a bad dancer.
words.defineEn: getting a bad and anxious feeling from a person or thing because we think something bad or dangerous will happen
words.defineVi: nhận được một cảm giác tồi tệ và lo lắng từ một người hoặc một vật bởi vì chúng tôi nghĩ điều gì đó tồi tệ hoặc nguy hiểm sẽ xảy ra

examples: Unfortunately, experience is the teacher of fools.
The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
That experience changed my life.
I had experienced the heaven on earth.
On the day of the wedding, Brown experienced cold feet.
words.defineEn: the skill and knowledge we gain from doing, feeling, or seeing things
words.defineVi: kỹ năng và kiến thức chúng ta có được từ việc làm, cảm nhận hoặc nhìn thấy mọi thứ

examples: The chairman's resignation finally brought matters to a head.
I gave the matter a lot of thought.
What's the matter with Matt?
Art is very much a matter of taste.
Local people took matters into their own hands and hired their own security guards.
words.defineEn: a situation or subject that needs to be dealt with or considered
words.defineVi: một tình huống hoặc chủ đề cần được xử lý hoặc xem xét

examples: She chose a knee-length skirt for the office.
May I choose the restaurant?
He chose a seat facing the door.
Many people choose not to marry.
He chose to go.
words.defineEn: to decide what we want to have or what is best for us from a group of options
words.defineVi: để quyết định những gì chúng tôi muốn có hoặc những gì là tốt nhất cho chúng tôi từ một nhóm các tùy chọn

examples: A mixture of skill and good luck decided the outcome of the game.
The courts decided in favor of the New York claimants.
The Appeal Court decided in their favour.
The case will be decided by a jury.
The government decided to abandon the proposed legislation due to public opposition.
words.defineEn: to think carefully about different things and choose one of them
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ cẩn thận về những điều khác nhau và chọn một trong số họ

examples: The decision is in the hands of the judge.
The decision comes in a case brought by the residents of a small town in Alabama.
This decision is, I feel, a huge mistake.
I can’t make a decision just yet.
The company's profits are on the rocks due to poor management decisions.
words.defineEn: the act of reaching a choice or judgement after careful consideration
words.defineVi: hành động đạt được một sự lựa chọn hoặc phán quyết sau khi xem xét cẩn thận

examples: These powers were eventually passed to municipalities.
It is no longer exercising power through velvet gloves.
Men still hold most positions of power in this country.
The machine is worked by wind power.
He came to power in 2019.
words.defineEn: the ability to do or achieve something
words.defineVi: khả năng để làm hoặc đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: Our waiter cleared the empty plates from the table.
The coast is clear.
Sanskrit inscriptions are clear as day.
The house rules are crystal clear.
The answers came back clear as a bell.
words.defineEn: easy to understand
words.defineVi: dễ hiểu

examples: The passion fruit smoothie is a popular choice at the café.
The refreshing Muscat grape juice was the perfect choice for a hot summer day.
Camembert is an excellent choice for a picnic.
A Granny Smith apple is a popular choice for juicing.
On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
words.defineEn: an act of deciding to choose between two things or more
words.defineVi: một hành động quyết định lựa chọn giữa hai điều hoặc nhiều hơn

examples: Can you remind me of your name?
The host reminded the guest that they didn't have all night, and that a drink is shorter than a tale.
He reminded himself that it was better a small fish than an empty dish.
The child's laughter reminded me that little fish are sweet, and that sometimes the simplest things can bring the greatest joy.
When he returned home from a long trip, his cat's purrs and affection reminded him that she was truly the light of his life.
words.defineEn: to bring a memory back to a person's mind
words.defineVi: để mang lại một ký ức trở lại tâm trí của một người
